article.title: Magnus Fiennes
article.text:
{{Short description|English composer, record producer and songwriter}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2014}} {{Use British English|date=August 2011}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2021}} {{Infobox person | name = Magnus Fiennes | birth_name = {{nowrap|Magnus Hubert Twisleton-Wykeham-Fiennes}} | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|1965|11|21|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Suffolk]], England | other_names = | occupation = Composer, record producer, songwriter | parents = [[Mark Fiennes]]
[[Jennifer Lash]] | relatives = [[Ralph Fiennes]] {{small|(brother)}}
[[Martha Fiennes]] {{small|(sister)}}
[[Sophie Fiennes]] {{small|(sister)}}
[[Joseph Fiennes]] {{small|(brother)}}
[[Hero Fiennes-Tiffin]] {{small|(nephew)}}
[[Ranulph Fiennes|Sir Ranulph Fiennes]] {{small|(cousin)}} }} '''Magnus Hubert Twisleton-Wykeham-Fiennes'''{{efn|This British person has the [[Double-barrelled name#British tradition|barrelled surname]] ''[[Twisleton-Wykeham-Fiennes]]'', but is known by the surname ''Fiennes''.}} (born 21 November 1965) is an English composer, record producer and songwriter.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/reviews/movies|title=Movie Reviews|date=9 July 2020|accessdate=14 July 2020|website=Nytimes.com}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1999/07/29/books/the-famous-fiennes-and-their-mother-s-blood-ties.html|title=The Famous Fiennes and Their Mother's 'Blood Ties'|first=Ralph|last=Blumenthal|date=29 July 1999|accessdate=14 July 2020|website=Nytimes.com}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2011/dec/03/martha-fiennes-magnus-fiennes-nativity-covent-garden|title=The famous Fiennes|date=3 December 2011|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=14 July 2020}} He has worked with artists such as [[Shakira]], [[Pulp (band)|Pulp]], [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]] and [[Morcheeba]]. In 1997 he produced the million-selling [[All Saints (group)|All Saints]] single "[[Never Ever (All Saints song)|Never Ever]]", which reached number 4 on the US charts and number 1 throughout Europe; producing and co-writing on their eponymous five million selling album. He composed and produced much of the two multi-million selling albums from the girl quartet [[Bond (band)|Bond]]. He has composed several major film scores, numerous commercials and TV series, including many seasons of leading BBC dramas such as ''[[Hustle (TV series)|Hustle]]'', ''[[Murphy's Law (UK TV series)|Murphy's Law]]'', and ''[[Death in Paradise (TV series)|Death in Paradise]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/artists/121d6d1a-dec1-41a0-8e28-a42bc1eb0b97|title=Magnus Fiennes - New Songs, Playlists & Latest News - BBC Music|publisher=BBC|language=en-GB|access-date=2020-04-05}} He also created developed and produced the $20 million animated cartoon series ''[[Freefonix]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://coolmusicltd.com/composers/magnus-fiennes/|title=Magnus Fiennes|website=Cool Music|language=en-GB|access-date=2020-04-05}} ==Records== As a producer/arranger programmer and re-mixer, Fiennes has worked with a diverse range of artists including [[Neneh Cherry]], [[Marianne Faithfull]], [[Bryan Ferry]], the [[Spice Girls]], [[Hal David]], [[Seal (musician)|Seal]], [[Yello]], Propaganda$2, Erazure, [[Eagle-Eye Cherry]], [[David McAlmont]], [[Ian McCulloch (singer)|Ian McCulloch]], [[Roland Gift]], [[Lenny Kravitz]], [[Nigel Kennedy]], [[Daniel Lanois]], [[Trilok Gurtu]], [[Damien Hirst]] (in the guise of Fat Les's Vindaloo), [[Dot Allison]], [[Justin Hawkins]], [[Jamelia]] and [[Geneva (band)|Geneva]]. Other work includes producing the double platinum "Watching Angels Mend" for Australian singer-songwriter [[Alex Lloyd]], a collaboration with Canadian violinist [[Lara St. John]] on the album of "Bach with beats" for Sony Classical, co-writing material with Massive Attack and the [[Sugababes]], and co-writing and producing album tracks and singles for [[Bertine Zetlitz]] (a Norwegian number one) and Liberty X. Although Fiennes now works primarily in the field of film and TV composition he was music director on [[Shakira]]'s "The Sun Come Out 2010 World Tour". Magnus Fiennes continues to develop and consult on US based film and TV projects including developing a TV series for Silver Television/Pictures. ==Work== ===Film=== *''Soup'' (1995) *''[[Preaching to the Perverted (film)|Preaching to the Perverted]]'' (1997) *''[[Onegin (film)|Onegin]]'' (1998) *''The Reckoning'' (2001) *''Peter Cottontail – The Movie'' (2005) *''Casper's Scare School'' (2006) *''[[Chromophobia (film)|Chromophobia]]'' (2007) *''[[Donkeys (film)|Donkeys]]'' (2010) ===Television=== *''Pleasureland'' (2003) *''[[Hustle (TV series)|Hustle]]'' (2004–12) *''Vital Signs'' (2006) *''Murphy's Law'' (2006–07) *''Five Days'' (2006) *''The Last Enemy'' (2007) *''[[Freefonix]]'' (2008–09) *''The Fixer'' (2008–10) *''Injustice'' (2011) *''[[Death in Paradise (TV series)|Death in Paradise]]'' (2011–present) ===Film tracks=== Fiennes has written and produced a number of featured songs including the title song for Paramount's ''[[Addicted to Love (film)|Addicted to Love]]'' (featuring Neneh Cherry), Madonna's ''Next Best Thing'' and Scala Pictures music business satire, ''Five Seconds to Spare''. Fiennes has produced tracks for Working Title's [[Rowan Atkinson]] vehicle, ''[[Johnny English]]'', and co-wrote the closing Massive Attack song on their score for the Luc Besson film, ''[[Danny the Dog]]''. ===Live=== As a keyboard player, Fiennes toured extensively with legendary blues guitarist [[Gary Moore]] in a line-up with Pink Floyd's [[Guy Pratt]] on bass and [[Gary Husband]] on drums. He was Music Director on [[Shakira]]'s "The Sun Come Out" 2010 World Tour. ==Personal life== Magnus Fiennes was born in [[Suffolk]], England in 1965, a son of photographer [[Mark Fiennes]] and novelist [[Jennifer Lash]]. He married Maya Dokic in 1995, and they have two daughters. One of six siblings, he is brother to actors [[Ralph Fiennes]] and [[Joseph Fiennes]], and film makers [[Sophie Fiennes]] and [[Martha Fiennes]]. Another brother, Jacob, is a conservationist. His foster brother, Michael Emery, is an archaeologist. ==Notes== {{notelist}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.magnusfiennes.com/ Official Website] *{{IMDb name|0276396}} *[https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2bbd4a289c Magnus Fiennes] at the [[British Film Institute]] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fiennes, Magnus}} [[Category:Fiennes family|Magnus]] [[Category:English composers]] [[Category:People from Suffolk]] [[Category:English people of Scottish descent]] [[Category:English people of Irish descent]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1965 births]] [[Category:English songwriters]] [[Category:English record producers]]
